citeinfo.origin: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, USDA Forest Service, and other Federal, State and local partners
citeinfo.title: Montana Hydrography Framework (National Hydrography Dataset)

descript.abstract: The National Hydrography Dataset (NHD) is a feature-based database that interconnects and uniquely identifies the stream segments or reaches that make up the nation's surface water drainage system. NHD data was originally developed at 1:100,000-scale and exists at that scale for the whole country. This high-resolution NHD, generally developed at 1:24,000/1:12,000 scale, adds detail to the original 1:100,000-scale NHD. (Data for Alaska, Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands was developed at high-resolution, not 1:100,000 scale.) Local resolution NHD is being developed where partners and data exist. The NHD contains reach codes for networked features, flow direction, names, and centerline representations for areal water bodies. The NHD also incorporates the National Spatial Data Infrastructure framework criteria established by the Federal Geographic Data Committee.This dataset is NHD Model version 2.2.1. See Model Diagram at: https://ftpgeoinfo.msl.mt.gov/Data/Spatial/MSDI/Hydrography/
descript.purpose: The NHD is a national framework for assigning reach addresses to water-related entities, such as industrial discharges, drinking water supplies, fish habitat areas, wild and scenic rivers. Reach addresses establish the locations of these entities relative to one another within the NHD surface water drainage network, much like addresses on streets. Once linked to the NHD by their reach addresses, the upstream/downstream relationships of these water-related entities--and any associated information about them--can be analyzed using software tools ranging from spreadsheets to geographic information systems (GIS). GIS can also be used to combine NHD-based network analysis with other data layers, such as soils, land use and population, to help understand and display their respective effects upon one another. Furthermore, because the NHD provides a nationally consistent framework for addressing and analysis, water-related information linked to reach addresses by one organization (national, state, local) can be shared with other organizations and easily integrated into many different types of applications to the benefit of all. This dataset is NHD Model version 2.2.1. See Model Diagram at: https://ftpgeoinfo.msl.mt.gov/Data/Spatial/MSDI/Hydrography/

idinfo.datacred: USGS, Montana State Library, and other contributors and base sources. See dataset feature-level metadata (tables: NHD Metadata, NHD Source Citation, and NHDFeatureToMetadata via key Meta_ProcessID; feature class to NHDFeatureMetadata via key Permenant_Identifier)

enttyp.enttypd: NHDPoint contains points representing NHD hydrographic landmark features.
enttyp.enttypds: NHD User Guide https://nhd.usgs.gov/userguide.html Also see NHD Model Diagram http://ftp.geoinfo.msl.mt.gov/Data/Spatial/MSDI/Hydrography

attr.attrdef: NHDPoint: Inundation Area (403); SeaOcean (445); Submerged Stream (461); CanalDitch (336); Levee (568); StreamRiver (460); Hazard Zone (373); Wash (484); BayInlet (312); Rapids (431); Foreshore (364); Bridge (318); Area of Complex Channels (537); Lock Chamber (398); Special Use Zone (454); Spillway (455); Flume (362); DamWeir (343); Water IntakeOutflow (485); Area to be Submerged (307)

enttyp.enttypd: NHDFlowlines consist of routes that make up a linear surface water drainage network.
enttyp.enttypds: NHD User Guide http://nhd.usgs.gov/userguide.html Also see NHD Model Diagram http://ftp.geoinfo.msl.mt.gov/Data/Spatial/MSDI/Hydrography

attr.attrdef: Underground Conduit (420) StreamRiver (460) Pipeline (428) ArtificialPath (558) CanalDitch (336) Connector (334) Coastline (566)
attr.attrdefs: NHD User Guide https://nhd.usgs.gov/userguide.html Also see NHD Model Diagram http://ftp.geoinfo.msl.mt.gov/Data/Spatial/MSDI/Hydrography

enttyp.enttypd: NHDLines represent linear NHD hydrographic landmark features used for cartographic representation.
enttyp.enttypds: NHD User Guide http://nhd.usgs.gov/userguide.html Also see NHD Model Diagram http://ftp.geoinfo.msl.mt.gov/Data/Spatial/MSDI/Hydrography

attr.attrdef: Tunnel (478); Bridge (318); Lock Chamber (398); Wall (483); Sounding Datum Line (503); Levee (568); Gate (369); Flume (362); Waterfall (487); Reef (434); Special Use Zone Limit (533); SinkRise (450); Rapids (431); DamWeir (343); Nonearthen Shore (411)
attr.attrdefs: NHD User Guide https://nhd.usgs.gov/userguide.html Also see NHD Model Diagram http://ftp.geoinfo.msl.mt.gov/Data/Spatial/MSDI/Hydrography

enttyp.enttypd: NHDAeas are areal hydrographic landmark features.
enttyp.enttypds: NHD User Guide http://nhd.usgs.gov/userguide.html Also see NHD Model Diagram http://ftp.geoinfo.msl.mt.gov/Data/Spatial/MSDI/Hydrography

attr.attrdef: Inundation Area (403); SeaOcean (445); Submerged Stream (461); CanalDitch (336); Levee (568); StreamRiver (460); Hazard Zone (373); Wash (484); BayInlet (312); Rapids (431); Foreshore (364); Bridge (318); Area of Complex Channels (537); Lock Chamber (398); Special Use Zone (454); Spillway (455); Flume (362); DamWeir (343); Water IntakeOutflow (485); Area to be Submerged (307)
attr.attrdefs: NHD User Guide https://nhd.usgs.gov/userguide.html Also see NHD Model Diagram http://ftp.geoinfo.msl.mt.gov/Data/Spatial/MSDI/Hydrography

enttyp.enttypd: NHDWaterbodies contain regions representing areal NHD hydrographic waterbody features.
enttyp.enttypds: NHD User Guide http://nhd.usgs.gov/userguide.html Also see NHD Model Diagram http://ftp.geoinfo.msl.mt.gov/Data/Spatial/MSDI/Hydrography

attr.attrdef: Playa (361); Ice Mass (378); SwampMarsh (466); Estuary (493); LakePond (390); Reservoir (436)
attr.attrdefs: NHD User Guide https://nhd.usgs.gov/userguide.html Also see NHD Model Diagram http://ftp.geoinfo.msl.mt.gov/Data/Spatial/MSDI/Hydrography

enttyp.enttypd: Area event must be tied to a NHDWaterbody. They cannot be linked to a linear or point feature. Area events are built into the NHD Model but are not accepted back into the National Database. They are meant to be used on an individual basis.
enttyp.enttypds: NHD User Guide https://nhd.usgs.gov/userguide.html Also see NHD Model Diagram https://ftpgeoinfo.msl.mt.gov/Data/Spatial/MSDI/Hydrography/

enttyp.enttypd: Linear Events are used to attach information about a flowline segment to the NHD. Linear events are built into the NHD Model but are not accepted back into the National Database. They are meant to be used on an individual basis. They also need a from and to location and a reachcode.
enttyp.enttypds: NHD User Guide https://nhd.usgs.gov/userguide.html Also see NHD Model Diagram https://ftpgeoinfo.msl.mt.gov/Data/Spatial/MSDI/Hydrography/

enttyp.enttypd: Point events are tied to a specific location on a stream network by a reachcode and a measure. While several types of Point Events are accepted back into the National Database, additional Point Event Types may be used on an individual basis. Locations of dams, stream gauges, water quality locations
enttyp.enttypds: NHD User Guide https://nhd.usgs.gov/userguide.html Also see NHD Model Diagram https://ftpgeoinfo.msl.mt.gov/Data/Spatial/MSDI/Hydrography/

enttyp.enttypd: The feature classes called Hydro Net and Hydro Net Junction contain the geometric network for the Hydrography Dataset with assigned flow direction for flowline features. Hydro_Net is an ESRI utility network, and Hydro Net Junction contains points for all flowline start and end nodes. These are produced when the NHD is extracted from the National Database and the network is given the name Hydro Net.
enttyp.enttypds: NHD User Guide https://nhd.usgs.gov/userguide.html Also see NHD Model Diagram https://ftpgeoinfo.msl.mt.gov/Data/Spatial/MSDI/Hydrography/

enttyp.enttypd: Contains associations of Permanent _Identifiers to external source identifiers (1:M)
enttyp.enttypds: NHD User Guide https://nhd.usgs.gov/userguide.html Also see NHD Model Diagram https://ftpgeoinfo.msl.mt.gov/Data/Spatial/MSDI/Hydrography/

enttyp.enttypd: Five-digit integer value comprised of the feature type and the combinations of characteristcs and values
enttyp.enttypds: NHD User Guide https://nhd.usgs.gov/userguide.html Also see NHD Model Diagram https://ftpgeoinfo.msl.mt.gov/Data/Spatial/MSDI/Hydrography/

enttyp.enttypd: In the NHD geodatamodel, feature-level metadata information is included in three tables: NHDFeatureToMetadata, NHDMetdata, and NHDSourceCitation. The NHDFeatureToMetadata table links the features to their instances of metadata. The NHDMetadata table contains the general metadata characteristics for each collection of features. The NHDSourceCitation table details the source associated with each metadata instance.
enttyp.enttypds: NHD User Guide https://nhd.usgs.gov/userguide.html Also see NHD Model Diagram https://ftpgeoinfo.msl.mt.gov/Data/Spatial/MSDI/Hydrography/

enttyp.enttypd: In the NHD geodatamodel, feature-level metadata information is included in three tables: NHDFeatureToMetadata, NHDMetdata, and NHDSourceCitation. The NHDFeatureToMetadata table links the features to their instances of metadata. The NHDMetadata table contains the general metadata characteristics for each collection of features. The NHDSourceCitation table details the source associated with each metadata instance.
enttyp.enttypds: NHD User Guide https://nhd.usgs.gov/userguide.html Also see NHD Model Diagram https://ftpgeoinfo.msl.mt.gov/Data/Spatial/MSDI/Hydrography/

enttyp.enttypd: In the NHD geodatamodel, feature-level metadata information is included in three tables: NHDFeatureToMetadata, NHDMetdata, and NHDSourceCitation. The NHDFeatureToMetadata table links the features to their instances of metadata. The NHDMetadata table contains the general metadata characteristics for each collection of features. The NHDSourceCitation table details the source associated with each metadata instance
enttyp.enttypds: NHD User Guide https://nhd.usgs.gov/userguide.html Also see NHD Model Diagram https://ftpgeoinfo.msl.mt.gov/Data/Spatial/MSDI/Hydrography/

enttyp.enttypd: the NHDFlow table provides feature to feature flow information for the NHDFlowline feature class. This flow table data is redundant with the network flow navigation available in the geometric network in both the personal and file geodatabase downloads. The flow table is intended to support interoperability with applications outside of ESRI geodatabase solutions.
enttyp.enttypds: NHD User Guide https://nhd.usgs.gov/userguide.html Also see NHD Model Diagram https://ftpgeoinfo.msl.mt.gov/Data/Spatial/MSDI/Hydrography/

enttyp.enttypd: hThe NHD Value Added Attributes are computed from the NHDFlow table and assigned to each drainage feature in the stream network. The values currently are not populated but will be in the future; they are essential to NHD Plus.
enttyp.enttypds: NHD User Guide https://nhd.usgs.gov/userguide.html Also see NHD Model Diagram https://ftpgeoinfo.msl.mt.gov/Data/Spatial/MSDI/Hydrography/

enttyp.enttypd: This table lists the schema and the version of the master NHD database that was used to generate extracted NHD data.
enttyp.enttypds: NHD User Guide https://nhd.usgs.gov/userguide.html Also see NHD Model Diagram https://ftpgeoinfo.msl.mt.gov/Data/Spatial/MSDI/Hydrography/

enttyp.enttypd: This table provides information that tracks changes, over time, to reach codes.
enttyp.enttypds: NHD User Guide https://nhd.usgs.gov/userguide.html Also see NHD Model Diagram https://ftpgeoinfo.msl.mt.gov/Data/Spatial/MSDI/Hydrography/

enttyp.enttypd: Table used to maintain links for backward compatibility with FOD-based systems.
enttyp.enttypds: NHD User Guide https://nhd.usgs.gov/userguide.html Also see NHD Model Diagram https://ftpgeoinfo.msl.mt.gov/Data/Spatial/MSDI/Hydrography/

enttyp.enttypd: NHDStatus is used to track data changes for transaction uploads to the central repository. This table is only populated during editing.
enttyp.enttypds: NHD User Guide https://nhd.usgs.gov/userguide.html Also see NHD Model Diagram https://ftpgeoinfo.msl.mt.gov/Data/Spatial/MSDI/Hydrography/

enttyp.enttypd: Used for features that cross but do not exchange flow, i.e rivers and canals.
enttyp.enttypds: NHD User Guide https://nhd.usgs.gov/userguide.html Also see NHD Model Diagram https://ftpgeoinfo.msl.mt.gov/Data/Spatial/MSDI/Hydrography/

enttyp.enttypd: HYDRO_NET_Junctions
enttyp.enttypds: NHD User Guide https://nhd.usgs.gov/userguide.html Also see NHD Model Diagram: https://ftpgeoinfo.msl.mt.gov/Data/Spatial/MSDI/Hydrography/

NHD data was originally developed at 1:100,000-scale and exists at that scale for the whole country. This high-resolution NHD, generally developed at 1:24,000/1:12,000 scale, adds detail to the original 1:100,000-scale NHD. (Data for Alaska, Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands was developed at high-resolution, not 1:100,000 scale.) Local resolution NHD is being developed where partners and data exist. The NHD contains reach codes for networked features, flow direction, names, and centerline representations for areal water bodies. The NHD also incorporates the National Spatial Data Infrastructure framework criteria established by the Federal Geographic Data Committee.This dataset is NHD Model version 2.2.1. See Model Diagram at: https://ftpgeoinfo.msl.mt.gov/Data/Spatial/MSDI/Hydrography/
